short_answers.question: An Epitome of Courage short answer question 1.
short_answers.answer: The lesson presents the inspiring life of Dr Stephen Hawking. Despite suffering from a severe physical disability, he never lost hope. His courage and determination helped him continue his research work. He proved that physical limitations cannot stop intellectual greatness.

long_answers.question: An Epitome of Courage long answer question 1.
long_answers.answer: â€˜An Epitome of Courageâ€™ highlights the extraordinary life of Dr Stephen Hawking. He was born in 1942 and grew up like a normal child. At a young age, he was diagnosed with a rare disease called ALS. The disease gradually weakened his entire body and confined him to a wheelchair. However, Hawking did not surrender to despair or fear. He continued his doctoral research with renewed determination. He made remarkable contributions to the study of black holes and cosmology. With the help of computers, he expressed his scientific ideas. His life stands as a powerful example of courage, optimism and perseverance.

However, Hawking did not surrender to despair or fear. He continued his doctoral research with renewed determination. He made remarkable contributions to the study of black holes and cosmology. With the help of computers, he expressed his scientific ideas. His life stands as a powerful example of courage, optimism and perseverance.
